channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Maxwell asked a judge to help improve her treatment in a Brooklyn federal lockup, saying her conditions were “uniquely onerous".
item.title: Epstein's ex-girlfriend Ghislaine Maxwell complains about prison conditions

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Greater Melbourne remains in stage four lockdown while other parts of Australia continue to battle new clusters of COVID-19 as the pandemic rolls on.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE updates: Victoria records 14 deaths, 372 new COVID-19 cases on Friday; NSW still facing ongoing cases; New Zealand cluster grows to 13

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The bill was signed off by Mr Beazley who was on standby waiting to give the royal assent, or make the legislation law.
item.title: WA Governor signs off emergency law to prevent Clive Palmer's '$30b lawsuit'

item.description: Follow news and events as they happen.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The refugee rights protesters lost a court action that barred them from blockading the Story Bridge on Saturday.
item.title: Protesters won't block Story Bridge but will still march for refugees

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: Victoria has recorded 372 new coronavirus cases and a further 14 deaths, with epidemiologists cautiously optimistic the state's second wave of infections has turned a corner.
item.title: Victoria records 372 new COVID-19 cases, 14 deaths

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The drug that Mesoblast has been trialling on some COVID-19 patients has just got the nod from a US regulator panel for treating children with severe responses to bone marrow transplants.
item.title: Mesoblast treatment gets US panel's key tick of approval

item.description: Kiwi philanthropists Dame Rosie and Michael Horton will be leaving a highly personal collection of Indigenous work to the Art Gallery of NSW.
item.title: Extraordinary love for an extraordinary collection of Indigenous art

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: In the last week both Epic and Microsoft have faced blocks on iOS as Apple keeps a tight grip on games and related revenue on its App Store.
item.title: Apple removes Fortnite from iPhone store over game payments tussle

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Amid fierce debate about the IOC's contentious Rule 50, a survey of past and present Australian Olympic athletes has delivered some striking results.
item.title: Olympic competition and podium no place for protests, say Australian athletes

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The Australian sharemarket is tipped to edge lower at Friday's open, following a mixed overnight session on Wall Street.
item.title: ASX set for subdued start; NAB Q3 cash profit down 7%

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: The lender's bottom line was hit by higher charges for bad loans and it warned it would be "increasingly challenging" to hit its target on costs management.
item.title: NAB profits slump 7%, meeting costs target 'increasingly challenging'

item.dc:creator: Roy Masters
item.description: Social media, agents, player empowerment, financial pressures and changing boardrooms are just a few of the things making it tough for coaches to survive.
item.title: Why NRL coaches have never been more vulnerable

item.description: Serena Williams tuned up for the US Open later this month by beating older sister Venus for the 19th time on the WTA Tour.
item.title: Serena beats Venus to take 31st meeting between sisters

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: The 1985 Brownlow Medallist and 2019 Australian Football Hall of Fame inductee abruptly ended his regular spot on 6PR's Weekend Brunch in sensational circumstances.
item.title: Radio regular hangs up on weekly segment after fiery ball bounce debate

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: "From their perspective, Western Australia is a great place for mining companies - but what does that say about our native title system, our workplace rights, and our environmental regulations," Conservation Council's Maggie Wood said.
item.title: Green groups perplexed after WA ministers spruik commendation by right-wing think tank

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: Traffic along Perth main roads has soared beyond pre-pandemic levels as commuters continue to shun public transport in favour of driving to the CBD.
item.title: Harmful vehicle emissions to soar as Perth commuters ditch public transport

item.dc:creator: Daile Cross
item.description: Meron Savage's world was turned upside down by the death of her daughter, Kate. She wants the numerous gaps in the system to be closed – and fast.
item.title: ‘A different kind of hell’: The agonising story of a Perth mum who couldn’t save her daughter

item.description: RB Leipzig have pulled off a Champions League upset to eliminate Atletico Madrid and reach the final four for the first time in their short history.
item.title: Leipzig stun Atletico Madrid to reach Champions League semi-finals

item.description: At prominent factories, bosses anxiously sought to deny reports of workers downing tools and walking out in protest.
item.title: Belarus factory workers strike as women protest in the streets

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set for flat start; RBA chief Lowe to speak

item.description: An eight-race card in the upper Hunter wraps up the working week for Racing NSW.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Muswellbrook on Friday

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: Democratic presumptive nominee Joe Biden has called for a nationwide mandate that would force Americans to wear masks outdoors.
item.title: 'It's about responsibilities': Biden calls for national mask mandate

item.description: England's seamers have made the most of muggy conditions to have Pakistan on the ropes at 5-126 after day one of the second Test.
item.title: England on top despite Abid Ali half-century for Pakistan

item.description: The bundles, dubbed "Apple One" inside the technology giant, will let customers subscribe to several of the company's digital services at a lower monthly price.
item.title: Apple set to offer subscription bundles to win loyalty

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The man was charged over four fires that caused damage to Highgate Hill homes on Wednesday night.
item.title: Wynnum man charged over spate of suburban fires

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: A man was arrested by police after allegedly driving a stolen car at high speeds through a school zone, hitting several cars.
item.title: Man charged after school zone smash-up with allegedly stolen car

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Police were called late Thursday night when the man failed to return.
item.title: Jet ski rider found after going missing overnight in Moreton Bay

item.description: Clinton, a Democrat, lost in the electoral college to US President Donald Trump in 2016 despite receiving more votes than him nationwide.
item.title: Clinton says she hopes Harris gets 'less sexist' treatment on campaign trail

item.description: Local moderators were told by ByteDance's Beijing headquarters to delete articles seen as "negative" about Chinese authorities on the BaBe app.
item.title: TikTok-owner ByteDance censored anti-China content in Indonesia until mid-2020: sources

item.description: The S&P 500 has eased in afternoon trading after briefly trading above its record closing high level for a second day.
item.title: Wall Street fades as record stays out of touch

item.description: What I certainly won’t do is feel I’m letting feminism down by catering to some patriarchal expectation that women need to remain youthful to be attractive.
item.title: When I started to go grey a few years ago, I made a personal decision

item.description: The US President has railed against mail-in balloting for months, arguing without evidence that the postal service's enlarged role in the election would perpetuate "one of the greatest frauds in history".
item.title: Trump says he's blocking postal funding because Democrats want to expand mail-in voting

item.description: Spain reported its highest daily infection total since the country's lockdown ended, while France also set a new post-lockdown daily high for the second day in a row.
item.title: Spain's daily coronavirus infections spike to nearly 3000, not yet second wave

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The family of a woman left in a vegetative state have lost their fight for compensation from the Queensland government, with the High Court ruling against them.
item.title: Qld family loses paramedic negligence case, ordered to pay costs

item.description: The two Middle Eastern nations reached a deal that will lead to a full normalisation of diplomatic relations in an agreement that US President Donald Trump helped to broker.
item.title: Israel and the UAE reach historic deal to normalise relations, with US help

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 14, 2020

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: Melbourne’s lockdown has hit business in the city hard but new data reveals Sydney’s economy is also sputtering despite a much lower COVID-19 caseload.
item.title: Melbourne's lockdown is dragging Sydney's economy down with it

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Coronavirus and renewable energy are driving down wholesale power prices as Angus Taylor warns retailers they must pass the savings on to their customers.
item.title: COVID, renewable energy combine to spark hopes for power bill relief

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: The Business Council says the days of a hands-off government approach are over as figures show a record 1 million Australians are out of work.
item.title: Time to pick winners: BCA says new approach needed to end recession

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Northern NSW residents have been cut off from Queensland neighbours by the border closure, bringing financial worries and medical risks, farmers say.
item.title: Farmers caught in cross-border nightmare urge bureaucrats to cotton on

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Friday, August 14

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: Police divers have just retrieved barnacled objects from Sydney Harbour in the investigation into the suspected political murder of the Turkish consul-general and his bodyguard in Dover Heights four decades ago.
item.title: Anonymous 1980 call to Sydney newsroom and the unsolved hunt for political assassins

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: Less than a third of Sydney commuters are wearing face masks on public transport, with a warning they will be made compulsory unless more people start to comply.
item.title: CCTV monitors how many are wearing masks on trains

item.dc:creator: Supratim Adhikari
item.description: Telstra boss Andrew Penn needs to get his “T22” overhaul plan back into full gear as quickly as possible to make sure investors aren't left out in the cold.
item.title: Telstra needs T22 to fire on all cylinders

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: New laws to be drawn up will make it easier to deploy the military to deal with national emergencies.
item.title: 'Lack of clarity': Laws to be changed to deploy the ADF domestically

item.dc:creator: Kristine Ziwica
item.description: The pandemic has exposed a backwards slide for Australia's women.
item.title: Women have gone from holding ground to losing ground

item.description: What's the best way to celebrate a workmate's birthday during the lockdown?
item.title: Party poppers or poopers

item.description: If our Premier really believes that "hoping" more people will wear masks will prevent another Victoria she is sadly deluded.
item.title: 'Hoping' doesn't mask that we're in a state of emergency

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Noise complaints from Brisbane suburbs of Hawthorne, Bulimba, Morningside, Balmoral and Norman Park trebled after Brisbane's new parallel runway opened last month.
item.title: Noise complaints take off from Brisbane Airport's new runway
